Exactly like the original!... What? You didn't play the original?? That's ok neither have I lol start your music player before the game for the ultimate driving sim/patience test, complete with air freshener, horn, mock mirror adjusting, flat tires, tow truck and SPOILER ALERT: infinite gas. Best of all, no obnoxious passengers! It also logs your play time and distance traveled, in realtime! Wow! ðŸ˜± Can't wait for VR version!
Missed the bus. Incompatible with my newer version of Android. Guess I'll have to walk to Tucson.

exactly what i was looking for/10 one little detail significantly added to my immersion: the time in-game is the time IRL. the clock there on the dashboard was the actual time! i couldn't figure out why it was dark, then I realized it was nearly midnight and it hit me. i'm really driving this bus. for the next eight hours. also, i live in tucson, so that immersed me even more.

absolutely magnificent. it shakes me to my very core just imagining playing this work of vintage art but puts me into deep sorrow knowing I might never play this simulation. but to my surprise this game exists outside of its original console and my feelings upon finding out were indescribable. well worth the dollar; 11/10 would drive again
best game ever!

Most realistic game ever. A masterpiece that belongs in the pantheon of gaming's hall of fame.

desert bus has been the best experience for me the realism of driving for eight hours and watching time pass by made the whole thing feel very realistic the lore in this game is phenomenal with so many memorable characters such as air freshener, bug splat, and most importantly the shrub that passes by when you drive with games as this good i believe this games surpasses the other games vodoo and playgendary makes. 10/10 THE best ending to a game ever

Desert Bus for hope!

It's a joke game made by Penn and Teller for the Sega CD and ported to IOS/Android, you drive in a straight line for 8 hours, and due to a slight veering to the right, it requires constant attention the whole time. I've heard that 5 hours in a bug hits your windshield. If you go off the road, a tow truck takes you back to the start in real time.  It's also what the charity-fundraising program Desert Bus for Hope revolves around, having raised and then donated hundreds of thousands of dollars to the Child's Play charity, and most if not all of the 99cent price for this app goes to the charity as well. Why not buy it, even if it's just to mess with your friends ("dude, you've GOTTA try this game, it seems boring at first but then it gets suuuper intense!").
Awesome. For those of you low star folks, it's a joke. Why would you buy it otherwise?
I know the game and the joke.  But I downloaded it to challenge my friends. Does the wheel actually work somehow so we can try the challenge? Thanks.

Bugs on the bus go splat splat splat. Splat splat splat. Splat splat splat. Bugs on the bus go splat on the windshield, and stay there all the way to Las Vegas. The wheels of the bus go round and round, round and round, round and round. The wheels of the bus go round and round as you try to drive to Las Vegas, until they unexpectedly go flat. The engine of the bus gets hot and hotter. The faster you go, the engine gets hot. Until the engine has a meltdown. The tow truck that toes the bus takes you back home
A stunning interactive portrait of gritty realism and existential angst. Fun for the whole family. Except that one Aunt.
Fun, funny, and for a good cause. What more do you need?
The most realistic game of all time. People who are giving it low rating clearly don't understand the reasoning behind it.

Hardcore baby, that's what this game is. One bus, one driver, one long, deadly road to Vegas. No saves, no pauses, just balls out, non-stop  action driving. It's like Fury Road in old school game form, without all the hot chicks and the "let's get out of the car" crap. Whether you're a Real American or just love Michael Bay, you deserve this game.

I feel my previous comment was a little too sarcastic for the haters. This game is a JOKE. It is supposed to be boring! The bus is supposed to veer horribly to the right! If you want your money back, take that up with the kid whose last days it just made that bit better.

Worst game I've ever purchased! Starts out in a pitch black "road" no controls or instructions on how to get the "bus" to accelerate. After a few seconds of "driving" the "engine" craps out, what sounds like  tow truck takes the "bus" away and it's game over.... Save your dollar!

There's no way I'll seriously play this game, but it's for a good cause. You one star raters are jerks. This is not a scam, it's a donation. P&T are realistic comical geniuses and good hearted people. Wish there was a larger donation option, I'll check for a website.

Holy crap...awesome! I've driven through the desert and it's invigorating! I've been waiting for a chance to have this same experience without having to spend money on gas. THIS IS IT!!! God bless the man who made this. This is for hardcore gamers and casual gamers alike. Buy this now!!! Now I'd like my refund. P.s. please release this on xbox.

Whenever I have to catch the bus from Tucson, Arizona, to Las Vegas, Nevada I always bring this game with me to get over the boredom of the trip. So real it's like your really there!  It's Busception!

Step into the shoes of Jocko, the legendary bus driver, whilst on the journey of a lifetime.  Will you be able to find the answers to the mind boggling questions of; when will the air freshener stop spinning, why is there no gas but the bus just keeps going, and why do my eyes feel like they are going to melt out of my head when staring at the action packed scenery.
... 'cause as a game it's just dumb.

Few games can make you see the light. This game happens to be that game.  At mile 26 I didn't know if I could keep going yet at mile 36, there was a calm that befell me.  Thanks for this game and the inner peace it has brought!
